title: Manipal Hospitals sweetens bid for Fortis hospitals
text:
April 10, 2018 / 5:52 PM / Updated 32 minutes ago India's Manipal Hospitals sweetens bid for Fortis hospitals Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
(Reuters) - India’s Manipal Hospitals Enterprises Private Ltd said on Tuesday it had raised its offer to buy Fortis Healthcare Ltd’s ( FOHE.NS ) hospital business by 21 percent. FILE PHOTO: A Fortis hospital building is pictured in New Delhi, India, March 28, 2018. REUTERS/Adnan Abidi 
The revised offer values the business at 60.61 billion Indian rupees ($933.18 million), or 116 Indian rupees per share, Manipal Hospitals said in a statement. 
The deal, which could create one of India’s biggest healthcare providers and help resolve an uncertain outlook for Fortis, was announced late last month. Reporting by Ismail Shakil in Bengaluru; Editing by Anil D'Silva
